lessonTitle: Ratios, Percents, and Problem Solving — Grade 6 Challenge

stages.headline: Welcome. Today you will use ratios, percents, and equations. Recall the ratio idea: /K \frac{a}{b} = \frac{c}{d} K/ means the two comparisons are equivalent.
Example: If a recipe uses /K 6 K/ cups of flour for /K 4 K/ servings, then the unit rate is /K \frac{6}{4}=1.5 K/ cups per serving.
What is /K 15\% K/ of /K 80 K/? Show your calculation on the board, then press Check.
Which expression is equivalent to /K 3(x+4) K/?

optionsQuiz.feedbackIncorrect: Not quite. Use the distributive property: multiply 3 by both x and 4.

stages.headline: Solve the equation /K 5n - 8 = 22 K/. Show your steps clearly and write the final value.
A team runs laps at a constant rate. Which table could represent a constant speed of /K 3 K/ laps every /K 10 K/ minutes?

optionsQuiz.feedbackIncorrect: Check if laps increase in direct proportion to minutes at 3 per 10 minutes.

stages.headline: A composite figure is made of a rectangle /K 8\text{ by }5 K/ and a square of side /K 3 K/ placed side-by-side without overlap. What is the total area (square units)?

optionsQuiz.feedbackIncorrect: First find each area (rectangle and square) and add them.

stages.problemText: Find total area of a rectangle 8 by 5 and a square side 3, non-overlapping.

stages.headline: A map scale is /K 1\text{ cm} : 50\text{ km} K/. If two cities are /K 6.4\text{ cm} K/ apart on the map, what is the real distance in kilometers?
stages.problemText: Convert a map measurement of 6.4 cm using the scale 1 cm : 50 km.

stages.headline: Well done. You used unit rates, percent calculations, equations, tables, and area. These are core Grade 6 skills.
